{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3388627,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-19T17:19:20.193Z","cooked":"

Team 3015 is proud to release the code for our 2024 season!

GitHub

GitHub - 3015RangerRobotics/2024Public: Public 3015 code release for the 2024...

Public 3015 code release for the 2024 season. Contribute to 3015RangerRobotics/2024Public development by creating an account on GitHub.

Highlights:

  • Use of behavior trees to automate upper mech functions and allow for autonomous cycling
    • Allows robot to “make decisions” based on current state and outside factors
    • Written in Kotlin just to experiment with it and utilize its null safety features
    • Created with a GUI editor, includes real time debugging feature to show which nodes are currently active
  • One button driver controls (most of the time)
    • Instead of directly controlling the robot, the driver presses one button to pass control of the robot to the “AutoPilot” behavior tree. This tree will decide whether the robot should pick up a game piece, score in the speaker/amp, or drive to a different position
  • Fully automated climb/trap sequence. When the climb button is pressed, the robot will pathfind to and align to the selected climb position, climb the chain, and score in the trap if it has a note
  • Physics based shooter aiming calculation
    • Calculates what angle and speed we need to shoot the note at to hit a target
    • Can target any position on the field. The same system is used for our speaker shot and passing
    • Handles shoot on the move simply by subtracting the robot’s velocity vector from the calculated launch vector, then targeting the result
    • We also simulate the note trajectory for log visualization and the ability to actually shoot notes in sim
  • Branching auto modes. Will move on to the next ring pickup if it misses a ring. The ring is detected by either the ring sensor in our shooter or the current draw on the intake.
  • Pit display that will show current event ranking, schedule, and stream as well as connect to the robot to provide diagnostic data and run our automated system checks. This is the same as last year but edited for this year’s robot.

Apologies if I missed this in the reveal thread - are you running this whole stack on the RIO or is there coprocessors involved?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-05-19T17:49:15.727Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":683,"readers_count":682,"score":141.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3388640,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-19T17:52:19.341Z","cooked":"

Everything is on the RIO except for AprilTag detection and note detection. AprilTags are on Orange Pi 5s. Note detection is on a limelight, but we originally did it with a jetson. Ran out of time to get the performance level we wanted for that so we switched over to a limelight.

I’m really interested in the behavior tree stuff, since our team uses kotlin. Could you explain how it works?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-05-20T14:12:41.329Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":600,"readers_count":599,"score":135.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Daniel C.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56324,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3389228,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-20T14:47:10.479Z","cooked":"

So our goal was to automate a lot more than we ended up doing. We prioritized the robot being competitive at its current level of automation before going any further with it so we just didn’t end up having the time to do much more.

Initial plans involved using lidar to detect other robots all around us and either avoid them while pathfinding or do anti-defense maneuvers if they were persistently in our way. So, we needed a system that could handle having the robot work towards some goal (game piece pickup, scoring, climbing, etc), and be able to decide when it needs to do something else along the way such as avoiding defense, or pick up a closer note than what it was going for. Stuff like that.

It would be possible to do this completely in the commands framework with command groups and triggers and such. However, it would become quite a large system that is pretty difficult to read, hard to debug, make changes to how it functions, etc. We thought behavior trees were more useful here for a couple main reasons:

  1. Easy to read and understand since it is edited in a GUI and execution follows the tree structure. Its pretty easy to look at the whole tree and be able to read through it to understand how it works. If this was in code, you’d have to trace through a bunch of different branching commands and would get lost pretty quickly. As an example, here’s a screenshot of the tree that controls our upper mech:
    image1066×562 50.1 KB

    If that was all command groups and triggers written in code, it would become pretty unwieldy really fast.
  2. Behavior trees have the concept of an action “failing”. You can use this to build some more complex behaviors pretty easily. As an example, say we currently want to score in the amp. We could be running a “score in amp” node that will drive to, then score in the amp. But, if another robot is currently blocking the amp, this node could fail, and we would move on further down the tree, perhaps to a node that leaves the note there for a partner, or just shoots it in the speaker. If the score in amp node succeeded, it would never go to these other options, and would just move directly to going for another game piece.

If you want some more info on behavior trees, this is a great video that explains it pretty well that I would show to our students: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6VBCXvfNlCM

We didn’t really end up making full use of the system this year that we hoped to, but hopefully sometime in the offseason or next year we can push it a little more.

Any chance you could explain more about how your lidar system works?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-05-20T23:11:21.391Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":492,"readers_count":491,"score":108.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Justin Hollister","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64179,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Melon"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/7","custom_user_title":"Melon","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3389647,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-20T23:23:32.918Z","cooked":"

Anything specific you want to know? Its not really anything fleshed out, more like a prototype. It essentially just loops through all the points, throws them out if they are in a location we expect to be a wall or something, then remaining points get grouped together if they are close to each other and then we assume that any group of points that is about robot sized is a robot.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-05-20T23:25:46.127Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":494,"readers_count":493,"score":103.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Michael Jansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64179,"username":"Bullzombie","name":"Justin Hollister","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/b5ac83/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/8","custom_user_title":"3015 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3389661,"name":"Justin Hollister","username":"Bullzombie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/b5ac83/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-20T23:46:12.745Z","cooked":"

What hardware do you use for lidar? I saw they’re connected to an Orange Pi and a Raspberry Pi unless I’m misreading something. Did you have to write custom code on the coprocessors to publish the points to Network Tables? If so could you point me to where that is? I haven’t seen anyone use lidar in FRC before so this is really interesting. Do you think its a feasible project for the offseason?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-05-20T23:46:12.745Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":498,"readers_count":497,"score":119.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Justin Hollister","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33850,"username":"mjansen4857","name":"Michael Jansen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64179,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Melon"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/9","custom_user_title":"Melon","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3389966,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-21T15:58:25.880Z","cooked":"

There was 2 of them, in opposite corners of the robot to give full coverage. They were connected to a raspberry pi and orange pi but if we did it for real it would have just been orange pis for both since we already had 4 on the robot. We experimented with both the RPLidar A1 and S3. I’ll try to find the code at some point, but the code on the hardware side is nothing special. It just uses an rplidar python library, reads the points, throws out points at an angle that would be our robot, then sends them over NT.

I think its feasible depending on what you are trying to do with it. If you’re trying to do some basic cluster detection like we did then its not really too difficult. You just need to have some very accurate localization in order to be able to filter out points that would be walls or field objects.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-05-21T15:58:25.880Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":481,"readers_count":480,"score":101.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Michael Jansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64179,"username":"Bullzombie","name":"Justin Hollister","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/b5ac83/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/10","custom_user_title":"3015 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3390054,"name":"","username":"Vasista","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/ccd318/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-21T18:37:35.434Z","cooked":"

Could you post a full res version of this?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-05-21T18:37:35.434Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":470,"readers_count":469,"score":149.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39370,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5940 | 4096 | WPILib and Robotpy Developer"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/11","custom_user_title":"5940 | 4096 | WPILib and Robotpy Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3390113,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-21T20:34:27.855Z","cooked":"

This is about as high res as I can get. You can open our robot code project in the behavior tree editor app if you need to zoom in more.

How much of the time did you end up running full auto cycles in matches? Or more driver assisted with auto scoring like 1690?

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T02:01:37.240Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":358,"readers_count":357,"score":116.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Elliot S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/16","custom_user_title":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400884,"name":"Justin Montois","username":"Justin_Montois","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/justin_montois/{size}/1512_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T02:32:25.176Z","cooked":"

Very rarely full cycles. However if you watch our matches anytime you see the flame effect on the LEDs the robot is performing actions with the driver holding a single button and the robot is doing the rest.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T02:32:25.176Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":357,"readers_count":356,"score":91.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Justin Montois","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50070,"username":"ElliotS","name":"Elliot S","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elliots/{size}/177628_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4746,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 | Drive Coach | FRC Top 25 | Tactical Genius"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/17","custom_user_title":"3015 | Drive Coach | FRC Top 25 | Tactical Genius","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400966,"name":"Ben Ketchum","username":"Splash3015","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/splash3015/{size}/187068_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T06:56:46.086Z","cooked":"

Like Justin said, we rarely ran fully autonomous cycles. All of our source pickup, amp scoring, speaker scoring, and climbing were all autonomous functions though. As he said, the driver could hold a single button and based on the state of whether or not we had a game piece, and whether the codriver had speaker or amp selected, the robot would perform that task on autonomously from anywhere on the field. We didn’t do full cycles much due to congestion and defense that the robot could not path around without driver input.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T06:56:46.086Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":94.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Ben Ketchum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50070,"username":"ElliotS","name":"Elliot S","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elliots/{size}/177628_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41750,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Mech/Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/18","custom_user_title":"3015 Mech/Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400967,"name":"Ben Ketchum","username":"Splash3015","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/splash3015/{size}/187068_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T06:59:07.932Z","cooked":"

@mjansen4857 will probably be able to provide a more detailed answer as this was not something I was heavily involved in. But from what I am aware of, we decided this over photonvision for better fps I believe. We also had slightly more accurate odometry with Northstar than we did when we tested photonvision.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T06:59:07.932Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":355,"readers_count":354,"score":81.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466530,"topic_slug":"3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release","display_username":"Ben Ketchum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54453,"username":"Alex_idk","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alex_idk/{size}/187712_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41750,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Mech/Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/3015-ranger-robotics-2024-code-release/466530/19","custom_user_title":"3015 Mech/Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3404788,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-02T19:13:09.685Z","cooked":"

We consistently got 2X the FPS with it over photon at the same resolution, so we were able to comfortably run at the full resolution of the cameras. But realistically, everything probably would have been fine with photon even at around 15-20 fps, so the benefits of more performance probably don’t outweigh all the kinks we had to work out by going with a custom solution.

We will probably do a deeper dive into comparing photon with what we ran this year during the offseason at some point to determine if its actually worth continuing with it or just switch to something else.
